conclusion: Determine which container (E or F) liquid will flow into after passing through baffles A, B, C, and D.
Baffle A is oriented horizontally from left to right.
Baffle B is oriented diagonally from top-left to bottom-right.
Baffle C is oriented vertically from top to bottom.
Baffle D is oriented diagonally from top-right to bottom-left.
Liquid from A will flow horizontally.
Liquid from B will flow diagonally from top-left to bottom-right.
Liquid from C will flow vertically.
Liquid from D will flow diagonally from top-right to bottom-left.
Container E has an opening that can receive liquid flowing horizontally or vertically.
Container F has an opening that can receive liquid flowing diagonally.
Liquid from A will flow horizontally and can enter Container E.
Liquid from C will flow vertically and can enter Container E.
Liquids from B and D will flow diagonally and can enter Container F.
Liquid will flow into Container E from A and C, and into Container F from B and D.
